subject: p12433541
History: Right upper lobe collapse after bronchoscopy.
Findings: Portable AP radiograph of the chest was reviewed in comparison to prior study obtained the same day earlier at : am. Since the prior study, there has been some degree of improvement in the right upper lobe collapse which is still present. Right hilar fullness is noted, consistent with post-radiation changes known from prior chest CT from. Rightward deviation of the trachea is unchanged.
